INRO Greeting brothers and sisters, we are back to our regular study. To the book of Romans. And at this point we are on the finish line. There are about 1,5 chapters left. And today we going to continue with the chapter 15.
Last time we studied Romans on Thanksgiving. Right before we had a “Christmas break”. But no we’re back! We stopped at the verse 20. So, today we will pick up from there.
But before we will read our scripture for today, let’s rewind a few verses back where apostle Paul explains His role in God’s plan. Providing some more reasons why he have written this letter. And very importantly what gave him the authority to speak into the life of that church.
Because remember, Paul did not established church in Rome. In fact he have never visited them. So, even though Paul was quite famous and controversial figure in Christian circles of the first century. He was not a part of that church. In a way he was a stranger. I think many have heard about him. But as for the church he was an outsider.
So, Paul writes this:
Romans 15:15,16 ¹⁵But I have written very boldly to you on some points so as to remind you again, because of the grace that was given to me from God,¹⁶to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, ministering as a priest the gospel of God…, so that my offering of the Gentiles may become acceptable, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
Paul was a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles. He had a unique role. He was appointed personally by Jesus Christ. He had a special mission and responsibility. To bring the Gospel of Christ to the Gentiles(non Jewish people). And authority that he had was unique to Him.
Unlike regular pastor of the church. When your authority AND responsibility bound by the very concrete group of people that God trusted you with. Paul’s authority and responsibility stretched over ALL gentiles. Across multiple churches. It was also backed by the power of the Holy Spirit. Which is very important.
Romans 15:19 ¹⁹in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Spirit; so that from Jerusalem and all around as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.
Paul presents the fruit of his ministry. Proof of his validity. Proof that he is a real deal. That God is with Him.
This verification was necessary. Because in a new testament time, and it is still true to this day, there were a lot of false teachers, false prophets, self proclaimed leaders etc.
People who cover up their hidden motives with Christian appearance. People ho have their own ambitions, agenda. Who pursue their won gals. Who try to use the church of God for their own purposes.
Jesus Himself warns us about it:
Matthew 7:15-18,20 ¹⁵“Beware of the false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravenous wolves.¹⁶You will know them by their fruits. Grapes are not gathered from thorn bushes, nor figs from thistles, are they?¹⁷So every good tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears bad fruit.¹⁸A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit.²⁰So then, you will know them by their fruits.
People can fool you and me. They can fake christian character. So much so that you cannot tell who is who until you see the fruit. The results of their work.
And this is real. Even in our own church we already experienced that. When people come, they smile into your face. They say nice things, presenting the best version of themselves in public. On Sundays, during the small groups throughout the week.
They know all the right words. Know all the right answers. Can quote scriptures upon scriptures. And you look at them and think
“Oh, this person way better them me. I don’t know bible nearly as well. I have issues with my character. But this guy/girl is perfect. Perfect follower of Christ. How come you are not the pastor or something…”
But then… At the same time this people engage in behind-the-scenes maneuvering to achieve their own goals. To satisfy their ego. Or I don’t even know what.
They go around approaching people in private saying things like “Let’s start our own church. This guys don’t know what they are doing. They are too this, they are too that… Church should be this. Church should be that…This church missing this and that… They don’t let people serve and etc.”
It’s a real problem that still exist. Maybe it is happening right now. I’m not gonna know. They not going to come to me. They gonna come to you.
It is especially challenging in the setting like ours. When we have new people joining our fellowship every week. On one hand you want to encourage people to serve, to edify one another. And on the other hand you want to prevent “ravenous wolves”, as Jesus called them, from having a go.
Back to Paul So, even though apostle Paul was very famous figure. For this particular church he was an outsider.
He did not hesitate to provide a prove that his motivation is pure. That he have authority given by God. That he CAN BE TRUSTED. And all he says is to help the Church to excel. To be the church God want’s them to be. All that he says add’s value. Builds up.
He did that by presenting the fruit of His work up to that moment. Second half of the verse 19:
Romans 15:19 ¹⁹…from Jerusalem and all around as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.
And then he says following:
Romans 15:20-24 ²⁰And in this way I aspired to preach the gospel, not where Christ was already known by name, so that I would not build on another person’s foundation;²¹but just as it is written:
“THEY WHO HAVE NOT BEEN TOLD ABOUT HIM WILL SEE, AND THEY WHO HAVE NOT HEARD WILL UNDERSTAND.”
²²For this reason I have often been prevented from coming to you;²³but now, with no further place for me in these regions, and since I have had for many years a longing to come to you²⁴whenever I go to Spain—for I hope to see you in passing, and to be helped on my way there by you…
He explains why he have never visited them. And now, even though he counts on their financial support to continue his ministry in Spain, he is not after money.
Paul in his letter openly shares all his concerns, suggestions and expectation. Advice and etc.
First of all he have authority to do that. As we could see. And also he did things right way. Which is an example for us to follow.
Application? There is no place for plotting, “pulling the strings” so to speak, in the Church. Church is not the place for trying to “Wheel a deal”.
If you have genuine concerns go the leaders. Go to a pastor and present them there. Openly. Start praying about it. It does work.
But If instead you are going around the church sabotaging the work of God. Please, Stop. You are not serving the Lord. You gonna summon the wrath of God on yourself. Please, go do something else. There are plenty of things to be busy with.
If someone coming to you and start to make you doubt your church. Leaders, pastor whatever. You don’t have to listen to that.
I really liked the response of one of the people who had experienced that situation few years ago. He said:
“If you have real concerns. Let’s go to the pastor together and talk them through…”
Don’t let seeds of the doubt to grow in your heart. This is how the enemy work. Right from the beginning. When someone comes to you and tries to makes you to doubt your faith, your church, your church leaders. They are not concerned about you. They have their own agenda in doing so. It is not the God’s way of doing things. This is how the enemy works.
Remember, by their fruit you’ll know them.
title: Romans 15:20-33

content:
INTRO Good evening, friends. If you are new here, my name is Viktar. It is an honor and a privilege for me to be with you tonight.
I promise I will not take too long, so we can continue our celebration.
We have been preparing for this day for a while now. We put a lot of thought and effort into it. We decorated our hall. We prepared musical pieces for our little concert. We prepared presents for our friends and family at home.
For many of us, the Christmas season is a very busy time. It can be stressful as well.
So now, I would really like us to take a moment, slow down a little. Bringing our attention back to the core — the very reason for this celebration.
Q: What do you mean by going back to the core?
Well…
Christmas, as we know it today, is actually quite new. Only about 100 years ago, Christmas took the form we all know. It became widely celebrated, even among non-religious people.
And this was not the result of a great revival or spiritual awakening. It was not about people coming back to God. Back to the Bible. No. None of that. It had nothing to do with faith in God.
The Christmas revolution, if you will, had much more pragmatic reasons.
For the most part, big companies and stores simply wanted to sell more products. You can read about it online. But a simplified version would sound like this:
Until 1900, Christmas was about remembering Christ’s birth. Families gathered, prayed, shared simple meals, and focused on gratitude, love, and generosity.
But after the 1930s, when Santa Claus came around, everything changed.
Christmas became more about shopping, gifts, decorations, and sales. The focus shifted to spending money, meeting expectations, and creating a “perfect” holiday.
Christmas is no longer centered around Jesus. Christmas without Christ is a reality for many people. A lot of people in this world, in this very city, will soon celebrate Christmas. Whether it is on the 25th of December or the 7th of January.
We will decorate our houses. We will put up our Christmas trees. We will cook special food and buy presents. We will invite our friends and family. We will celebrate! But how many of us will celebrate Jesus?
Preparing for story… Here at Calvary Chapel, we believe in Jesus. God who came down to earth. He is our Lord and Savior. And this is not just words. We are not about being religious. We pursue a living faith.
That is why we should take Christmas seriously. And not just rush through this season, using it as an excuse to treat ourselves and our loved ones to something special.
Story? Imagine your wife’s birthday is coming up.
And I’ll be like, “Honey, it’s your birthday! This is so cool. Finally! I’ve been counting the days! You must be so happy! I am sooooo happpppyyy!!!”
You know what I did this year? Because I love you so much, I decided to treat myself. I bought a new phone, a new gaming console, and new set of fishing rods! Isn’t that the best day ever? I’ve been saving all year.
Also, hun, I’ll go bowling with my buddies. They suggested going to a restaurant afterwards, and I think I’ll join. It’s your birthday after all! It should be special. It should create memories.
new phone rings
“Oh, guys are already here to pick me up”
Okay. I gotta go. Have a good one.
Bye!
… Love you! …
Connection First of all, this is NOT marital advice. Please don’t try this at home. Otherwise, you risk creating memories you will never forget indeed.
As weird as this example is, this is exactly how many people celebrate Christmas, paying no attention to Jesus and focusing entirely on themselves.
That’s why, for the last few weeks, we’ve been talking about Jesus’ birth. We looked at the birth of Christ as a message of peace, joy, and hope for all people, reflecting on the true meaning of Christmas, which is about the Savior being born.
We’ve been lighting up these candles every time we discover one of these topics because… Well, mostly because it looks cool and kids love it :) There is nothing secret or sacred about these candles. So, without further ado, let’s light up our last candle, which is the candle of love.
Message of Love John 3:16 ¹⁶“For God so loved the world, that He gave His only Son, so that everyone who believes in Him will not perish, but have eternal life.
The birth of Jesus is the message of God’s love to people. Yes, Jesus came to save us. But he also came to teach us about love. To show us what God is like. That he is a loving Father. He is love.
Jesus was born because “God so loved the world…” In other words, God loved me and you so much that he decided to step in and save us. So that we would have eternal life.
This shows us God’s attitude towards us. And it is love all the way. He loves us so much more than we can imagine. Definitely more than we deserve.
Application God so loved you that he gave his only Son, so that you would not perish but have eternal life. Think about it… Isn’t it beautiful?
Notice that all the effort is on God’s side. All the benefits are on your side. How is it possible? It is hard to believe. Hard to accept.
We tend to think we should do something to earn God’s love and favor. We should prove we deserve it. If we were good people, followed all the rules, and all that, maybe then we would believe…
Because we are so used to “selfish” or “self-centered” love, which, one way or another, still seeks to receive. Even when giving away.
There are so few examples of true “selfless” love in our world today. That makes it hard for us to accept the “selfless” and “unconditional” love of God.
The birth of Jesus is the greatest gift for you and me. God gave us his Son so that through Him we would be adopted into His family.
Again, all the work is on God’s side, and all the benefits are on our side.
Why? - Because God so loved the world.
“…Jesus revealed the heart of God the Father in sending God the Son; to bring salvation — rescue, hope, healing — to the world through Him.” - David Guzik
Today I want to invite you to ponder this and reflect on God’s love during the Christmas season.
John 3:16 ¹⁶“For God so loved the world, that He gave His only Son, so that everyone who believes in Him will not perish, but have eternal life.
And if you want to know more about God’s love, if the phrase “personal relationship with God” is not something that applies to your life but you wish it did, you can come and talk to me afterwards.
For now, let’s say a couple of words in prayer, expressing our gratitude for the love of God given to us.
title: Christmass 2025

content:
START Greetings, church. We are 10 days away from Christmas—it’s coming fast. Today we are going to continue reflecting on the birth of Christ. It’s time to light our second candle and talk about joy.
…
I want to start with a question: what is joy?
…
When you hear the word joy, what comes to your mind?
…
For me, it would be words like happiness, laughter, smiles… and those are all good words. When we hear joy, or to be joyful, many of us immediately think about happiness, or being happy. A state when everything goes well. When everything is right. For me, as well as for many other people, joy and happiness are interchangeable terms—two ways to say the same thing.
Now… you probably already know this, but I was surprised to learn that happiness and joy are NOT in fact the same thing — at least from a biblical point of view.
Happiness is our reaction to circumstances and external events.
A reaction to things going well.
Happiness You buy something at a much lower price — you feel happy. You receive a gift — you feel happy. You catch a fish or fix something. Or you pay your bills and, despite all odds, still have money left in your wallet — nothing makes you happier than that. Whatever it might be, it’s good circumstances that trigger a positive reaction. That’s what we understand by being happy. But because it’s only a reaction, it is fully dependent on the situation and circumstances.
Difference Happiness can be momentary. You can feel happy for a brief moment — for a few minutes, a couple of hours — but overall still live in depression, misery, or apathy. It is only when something very good happens that you experience this spike in happiness, which quickly dies down.
In other words happiness - it’s when the source of your joy is external.
It’s like relying on rain as a source of drinking water. You have no control over it. Your life is fully at the mercy of the weather. And sometimes our life can be like the rainforests of Adjara — where it rains hard almost every day.
NIKO AT HALA Once we did the first day of our NIKO camp in the Mtirala rainforest during the rainy season. NIKO is a kind of extreme camp — you could even say it’s somewhat like a boot camp. There are a lot of challenges, both physical and mental, with plenty of hiking and all that. Basically, rain is not something we worry about at all at NIKO camps. In fact, we actually pray for rain on at least some days of the camp to add more drama to the challenges you’re going through.
But that time in Mtirala, it was different. It was raining — actually, we got so much rain, you couldn’t even imagine. It was literally a wall of rain all day long. You got wet immediately unless you hid somewhere. The rain made so much noise that you had to shout right into the ear of the person next to you if you wanted to be heard.
We couldn’t do anything. We were hours behind schedule because it rained so hard. Little rivers appeared out of nowhere and flowed around us. It was impossible to continue our program because of how much rain there was.
CONNECTION And if we are at such a stage of life when everything goes well, you have more than enough reasons to be happy. You might think there’s no problem — who cares about digging a well when you get so much rain!
We might think we are in no need of the fullness of joy — that momentary happiness is good enough. We can live happily without God. Or most likely, we simply don’t think about it at all. We feel happy — who cares where it’s coming from?
Due to the abundance of rain, relying on it doesn’t seem to be an issue. You might think, “What’s the big deal? I have plenty of water anyway.”
OUR LIFE NOT A RAIN FOREST Unfortunately, for most of us, life is not a rainforest — at least not for very long. I know some of us today are lacking in the happiness department, feeling apathy, indifference, maybe even depression. More often, life feels like a desert rather than a rainforest.
Or maybe we just don’t have anything to collect the water with. So even when it rains, you just stand there with your mouth open, trying to catch as many drops as possible, hoping it will satisfy your thirst. It’s not a very effective strategy — believe me, I’ve tried. It’s not going to work.
For the vast majority of people, relying on rain is simply not an option. Just like we can’t live without water, we cannot live without joy. And just as rain cannot fulfill our need for fresh drinking water, momentary happiness is not going to be enough.
Joy On the other hand, we have joy, which, although not the opposite of happiness, is still different. It has a deeper meaning. Fullness of joy, as it is described in the Bible, is an enduring state that persists regardless of whether circumstances are good or bad.
Unlike the momentary nature of happiness that this world has to offer, the joy that comes from God is constant. Feeling happy depends on ever-changing circumstances, but joy is permanent and does not depend on the situation. Joy is superior in every way, and it is a free gift that comes from God.
Luke 2:10 ¹⁰And so the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid; for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be for all the people;
The joy of God is inclusive. It is for ALL PEOPLE. It is available for you and me — no credit card required! All you need is written in John 7:38.
John 7:38 ³⁸The one who believes in Me, as the Scripture said, ‘From his innermost being will flow rivers of living water.’ ”
It’s about the change that happens in you. It starts with repentance. You cannot experience the fullness of joy that comes from God until you reconcile with Him. Fullness of joy comes through the work of the Holy Spirit in us.
Momentary happiness is not meant to last. Just like rain, it comes and goes—like that brief spike of a nice feeling in the darkness of your life.
Fullness of joy is different. It is enduring and persistent — like a water spring. It’s always flowing. It’s not a short-lived flash of light that brightens the darkness for a brief second. It’s like turning on a light, casting out the darkness from your life.
John 15:11 ¹¹These things I have spoken to you so that My joy may be in you, and that your joy may be made full.
When we receive HIS joy, we don’t have to rely on external circumstances anymore. Our joy becomes complete — made full. We don’t have to rely on the rain because we have an unlimited source of living water right within us, always at hand, so to speak.
DOESN’T MEAN NO SORROW Fullness of joy does not mean that from now on we will never, ever be sad again. No — unfortunately, we still live in a broken world. There are times for grief and sadness, times to weep with those who weep, and all that. It is only at the end of time that all suffering will pass away.
Revelation 21:4 ⁴and He will wipe away every tear from their eyes; and there will no longer be any death; there will no longer be any mourning, or crying, or pain; the first things have passed away.”
In the future, we will have no reason to be sad. But meanwhile, even when you have the fullness of joy, you can still feel sad — maybe even unhappy at times. But it’s only momentary. It’s not overwhelming, paralyzing, or a life-controlling feeling. Even though you are sad at times, overall you still live a life full of joy.
Before his suffering on the cross Jesus told his disciples:
John 16:22 ²²Therefore you too have grief now; but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one is going to take your joy away from you.
The fullness of joy that Jesus offers us is not a mere reaction to a trouble-free, easy life. He does not say you will not be challenged. No. Instead, Jesus offers us a source of strength to overcome challenges. A new way of living where we stay joyful even when not everything goes well.
Jesus offers us His Joy which does not depend on external circumstances. Joy that stays, lasts.
Fullness of joy comes from the work of the Holy Spirit in our lives. When we surrender to God and get filled with His Spirit, it becomes evident. We often call it the “fruit” of the Spirit — the results or noticeable changes in our life that come when we repent. When we turn away from OUR way of life. Go back to our Father to accept His will.
Galatians 5:22 ²²But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
The Holy Spirit lives in those who surrender to God and follow Him. The Holy Spirit lives in every child of God. You cannot see the Holy Spirit, but once you start to get filled with Him, it becomes noticeable. There is a visible fruit of His presence in your heart. We talked about peace last week — perfect peace that comes from God. It is a fruit of the Spirit. And when we think about joy, it also comes as a result of the Holy Spirit living in us.
EXAMPLE A couple of years ago, we went on a hike with teenagers—a new route in the mountains of Adjara. It was a special one because you had to apply for permission ahead of time. But we got approval from the border police and happily set off.
Those days, I was on a strict diet: 0 carbs, 0 sugar, period. In addition, I ate only once a day, later in the afternoon, or sometimes, secretly, every other day. It was an optional part of the diet, but I decided to do that too. It will be important later on.
You know, I had been relatively fit my entire life. Hiking was never a problem for me. Usually, I tended to walk last, but only to make sure no one was left behind. The only hike that challenged me was the one with super-steep trails, when I had to carry a really heavy backpack plus a kid on my shoulders. This time, we didn’t take our kids with us—no heavy backpack either. Therefore, I did not anticipate any difficulty whatsoever, or at least nothing that would be seriously challenging.
…
I could not have been more wrong. Less than a couple hundred meters into the hike, I realized that something was not right. I was far behind everyone else—not because I was waiting for the slowest people in the group. No, it was because I simply could not walk any faster. I was the slowest person in our group.
My heart was racing like crazy. I was short of breath. Every single step was torture, requiring 100% effort. I thought I was going to have a heart attack or something. I had never felt that bad in my entire life. I was thinking to myself, “Is this the hill I’m willing to die on? I mean, literally.”
CONNECTION This is how life feels without the Holy Spirit—without the fullness of joy that comes through His work in us.
On the surface, I was just fine. Not eating didn’t seem to be a problem for me. I didn’t feel hungry. But a little bit of pressure and difference became evident.
It’s easy to be in a good place. To be a nice person, when everything goes well. When the circumstance of your life is where you want them to be. In this moment you can say I don’t help of the Holy Spirit.
But when we are in a bad place — maybe we’ve made a bunch of mistakes, maybe our life in general is not a walk in the park. Or maybe everything looks fine on the surface, but inside there is no joy, no purpose, no meaning. We just roll through our days because that’s what we’ve always done.
CONCLUSION Maybe today you suffer from chronic depression, sadness, or hopelessness. You’ve lost your motivation, resilience, purpose…
There is an answer. You don’t have to continue living like this. There is a better way. God offers the fullness of joy to all people who are willing to believe, who are willing to surrender to Him, and get filled with the Holy Spirit.
Romans 15:13 ¹³Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that you will abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
title: Advent - Joy

content:
START Greetings brothers and sisters. The Christmas season has arrived. Advent has already begun. We know that Advent is not a biblical concept. It is a tradition that came later. But I think it’s a good one.
Even though we do not follow many traditions in Calvary Chapel, sometimes we adopt the best ones.
In the last few years we have done special talks during the Advent season, like many Protestant and Orthodox churches. We focus on Christmas topics such as “Peace”, “Love”, “Joy”, and “Hope”. It helps us slow down and reflect on the birth of Christ. What does Christmas really mean for us? What has changed in this world because He came?
Today we will light our first candle, and talk about Peace.
Peace Peace is a very good thing. There are many different definitions of peace. But in general, it means:
Peace is a state of calm and harmony where there is no conflict, fear, or violence
Or if we talk about inner state of a person:
It is when someone feels safe, and not worried or disturbed.
We all like to feel at peace, don’t we? It is very natural for us to long for peace.
For our family, peace is when we go to the sea early in the morning. We drive to our secret spot in Gonio. [ IMAGE OF PEACE ] Before you even see the water, you can already feel the salty breeze. You walk closer and lie down by the waves. They rock gently. No one is around. The sun shines on you. You feel calm and relaxed. You feel at peace.
How many of you would like to do that instead of going to work tomorrow?
We love peace. It feels good. And we don’t like the opposite of peace — fear, disturbance, and distress. We don’t want those. That’s for sure.
Stress is a silent killer. It destroys you from the inside out. Nobody enjoys it. You age faster than you should. You become prone to many diseases. Your physical and mental health suffers greatly:
According to the internet:
“High stress leads to serious physical issues like heart disease, high blood pressure, obesity, weakened immunity, and digestive problems, plus mental health impacts such as anxiety, depression, irritability and so on and so forth.”
[IMAGE OF A STREES]
Blessing On the other hand, peace is like a magic pill. It protects you from those negative effects. It is good for both your physical and mental health. Being at peace can literally extend your life. Peace is a great blessing that comes from God.
2 Thessalonians 3:16 ¹⁶Now may the Lord of peace Himself continually grant you peace in every circumstance. The Lord be with you all!
The peace that comes from the Lord is something different. It is bigger and better than what this world calls peace. Only God has a real thing. The Bible talks a lot about it. We have been studying the book of Romans for the last few months, and here is what we find there:
Romans 5:1 ¹Therefore, having been justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,
Romans 12:18 ¹⁸If possible, so far as it depends on you, be at peace with all people.
Romans 14:19 ¹⁹So then we pursue the things which make for peace and the building up of one another.
And these are only a few mentions. There are more.
But even from these few we can see God’s desire. His will is for me and you to be at peace:
With Him — to be reconciled and repent.
With ourselves — to have inner peace.
With one another — both in and outside the Church.
Peace with God First, and most importantly, the most fundamental level of peace in our life is peace with God — the reconciliation made possible through Jesus Christ.
Long ago, we broke that relationship. We chose to live by our own wisdom, to follow our own will, and to decide for ourselves what is good and what is evil. We wanted to be like God.
Genesis 3:5 serpent says to Eve: ⁵…God knows that on the day you eat from it(this tree) your eyes will be opened, and you will become like God, knowing good and evil.”
And our response was: [VIDEO: I Want it all]
We have said, “I want it all! And I want it now!” Just like in the parable of the prodigal son, we left our Father’s house to live on our own, following our own wisdom and doing our own will. In doing so, we broke our peace with God.
John A few weeks ago, on Sunday, I was walking to church. The day was wonderful. Amazing weather. No wind. The sun was shining, flooding the streets with bright light. It was not too hot, not too cold. Just perfect.
As I was approaching the intersection here, I ran into a guy — let’s call him John. John used to come to our church every now and then a couple of years ago. I stopped to say hi, and we started talking.
Our conversation ended up being quite long. I knew he had been a member of a different church in Batumi for many years, but I also knew he had left that church some time ago. We talked about faith and God, and he said something like this:
“I don’t care about eternity. All I want is to be happy right here, right now. I don’t want to do God’s will. I want to do mine. And if God’s will happens to go the same way… well… great. I don’t mind. I just want to live my life my own way.”
Story repeats itself You see, the story repeats itself. We still fall for this. Eight thousand years of recorded history in the Bible, and we still fall for “You will become like God, knowing good and evil…” Even today, we deny peace with God to try to be the Lord of our own lives.
Therapy And later we find ourselves at the therapist asking:
“Is there anything I can do for anxiety and stress?”
“Yes! Rest in God’s will. Prescribed daily.”
Go back to the Father. Give in to His will. Put your trust in Him, and He will give you peace. This will help with your stress and anxiety.
When we come back to the Father, He will not kick us out. He is waiting for us. He wants us to come back!
We should stop trading the peace we can have with God for the lies this world offers. We should stop wearing ourselves out with stress and anxiety, trying to figure out life on our own — always restless, always anxious.
We can have the peace of God, if we reconcile with Him through Jesus, the Prince of Peace.
…
Isaiah 9:6 ⁶For a Child will be born to us, a Son will be given to us; And the government will rest on His shoulders; And His name will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Eternal Father, Prince of Peace.
It was written about 800 years before the birth of Christ. The great promise - promise of peace.
Prince of Peace Jesus came to reconcile us with the Father. He came to give us peace — true peace. And it begins with one essential step.
If you are not at peace with your Father in heaven, you cannot have true peace within yourself.
…
If you are not at peace with your Father in heaven, you cannot have true peace within yourself.
…
People search for peace in alcohol, in drugs, in relationships, in wealth, in fame, in their careers — all kinds of things. Sometimes they find something they call peace or happiness. But there is only one source of true peace.
John 14:27 ²⁷ Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you…
Source True peace can be found in a manger. The only source of peace is Jesus. Only through Him can we have true peace — a peace that does not depend on circumstances, well-being, financial stability, or anything else.
“With faith in God and His Son, with the receiving of His Spirit and His peace, we can have an untroubled heart in a quite troubled life.” (David Guzik)
True peace is not about escaping troubles or having an easy life. True peace is being untroubled in any circumstances.
Story A few years ago, I had a minivan — a Mazda 5. [PICTURE MAZDA] I claimed that, despite its look, it was as good as any SUV. I gave the suspension a lift. It had a powerful engine, wide wheels, and big rims. To me, it felt like an SUV. I never got stuck anywhere while driving it.
On the other hand my friend Matt also had an SUV. [ PICTURE PRADO ] With big, fat tires, locking differential. Lowered gears. All the good stuff.
Driving around Batumi, Tbilisi, and nearby areas on our regular routes, I didn’t feel much difference between the two — except for the appearance, of course.
But one day we decided to go to Khikhani fortress [ PICTURE KHIKHANI ]. Together with our families. The fortress located near Khulo. It’s in the mountain Adjara. Very close to the border with Turkey.
We took off from Batumi, and while we were on the asphalt, both cars performed really well. When we hit a light gravel road, I was still confident. My SUV was driving just fine.
But the further we went, the worse the road became — more bumps, deeper holes. Matt kept plowing through them with confidence. I, on the other hand, grew more and more worried that we might not make it.
I had to slow down. I had to maneuver like crazy to avoid the bumps and holes, using all my driving knowledge and experience. But despite my efforts, we soon had to come to a complete stop. My homegrown SUV could not go any further. The road had become too rough.
That day I learned something important. No matter how much I wanted my car to be an SUV, it was not. When it faced a real test, it became obvious.
…
Just like my DIY SUV could not keep going when the road got rough, the illusion of peace that this world offers disappears in the face of real trouble…
Only the peace that comes from God continues, no matter the circumstances or obstacles.
Only God’s peace allow us to “maintain untroubled heart in a quite troubled life.”
Isaiah 9:6 ⁶For a Child will be born to us, a Son will be given to us; And the government will rest on His shoulders; And His name will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Eternal Father, Prince of Peace.
The true source of peace cannot be found in alcohol, drugs, or success. True peace was found in a manger. Only in Jesus Christ can we have a true sense of peace.
2 Thessalonians 3:16 ¹⁶Now may the Lord of peace Himself continually grant you peace in every circumstance. The Lord be with you all!
The Prince of Peace offers His peace to you tonight. If you struggle with anxiety, stress, or brokenness, the solution is to come back to the Father — to surrender to Him and rest in His will. He, as a good Father, will give you peace.

Life of worship For a last few weeks we’ve been talking about living the LIFE OF WORHSIP. And today we gonna continue with this topic. If new here, we are studing the book of Romans. Currently we’re at the chapter 12. At the beginning of this chapter we are presented with the concept of a “living sacrifice” — a spiritual service of worship that is acceptable to God.
Question Did you ever asked yourself a question. What does God want’s me to do? What is the will of God for my life?
If you never thought about it. Well… you probobly should. It is an important question. Once you know the answer life start to make so much more sense. And honestly the answer is not complicated.
We are about to uncover the secret and sacrid truth, so I’ll need your full attaention. Let this truth soak in, and it will revolutionize your life.
Are you ready?
God desires that your life be a song of love to Him.
What?
God desires that your life be a song of love to Him.
But, I don’t understand. I am no singer. And what does it even mean?
Example Yeah, I know how that feels. Many years ago, when I was very yang and naive. I was looking for a secret of singing. I wanted to sing good. Actually, I wanted to be really good. And those days predate youtube and white spread of information. So, I had to digg in into forums and dodgy websites searching for the answer “How to become a good singer”. And you would not belive how much rubbish is out there. Hours of my life and liters of tea were waisted on that endless search. But then, one day, luck was on my side.
I found a training programm! It looks very promising. Looks legit! I hit download and start waiting.
Serveral following ours felt endless. But, now I have it. The secret tool that will unlish my voice!
I had to wait until I was home alone. And finally, I can go into my room. It is dark hare, because computer monitor is the only source of light. House is so quite, the only noises are from computer cooler spinning. I can hear my heart pounding in my chest. My palms are sweaty, because I’m so nervouse. What if it’s yet another fake?
Few moments of hasitation and then. I sit down and pressed the play button. Music starts to play, and after a short into the vocal coach finally starts speaking. I’m all ears for what he says. And…
“Keep your throat relaxed and open, so air flows freely and your voice can resonate.”
WHAT?
“Raise your soft palate slightly”
WHAAAT?!
“Gently bring your vocal folds together without squeezing, letting them vibrate freely.”
WHAAAAAAAT?!! Is that it?? That is what I was looking for???
Generally speaking yes. In a nutshell it is the recepe for a great sounding voice.
Luckly, the program included hours and hours of vocal excersises for practice, with the examples to follow.
Bridge You know, both, our christian life and singing. Is not about knowing a “secret formula of a success”. Some sort of a hidden knowladge that avalible to only a few. No, it’s about excersising the right thing day after day. Because, you know, one thing that sets professionals apart from ammatures, is that professionals keep practicing day in and day out. They are working out, they are consistently building their voice.
Living a life of worship is about practicing, excersising or as it put in Philippians 2 “working out out selvation”.
Before we will dive into our scripture for today, I’d like to preface this by saying everything that we gonna talk about assumes that you are born again, filled with spirit, follower of christ. Because, otherwise, without the help of the Holy Spirit, it will be extremely hard if not imposibble to live the life of worship. But above all it will be prettey much pointless in regards of eternal life. Because again, selvation and forgiveness is not by what you do, but by faith and faith alone.
With that being said let’s start reading:
Romans 12:9-21 ⁹Love must be free of hypocrisy. Detest what is evil; cling to what is good.¹⁰Be devoted to one another in brotherly love; give preference to one another in honor,¹¹not lagging behind in diligence, fervent in spirit, serving the Lord;¹²rejoicing in hope, persevering in tribulation, devoted to prayer,¹³contributing to the needs of the saints, practicing hospitality.
¹⁴Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse.¹⁵Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.¹⁶Be of the same mind toward one another; do not be haughty in mind, but associate with the lowly. Do not be wise in your own estimation.¹⁷Never repay evil for evil to anyone. Respect what is right in the sight of all people.¹⁸If possible, so far as it depends on you, be at peace with all people.¹⁹Never take your own revenge, beloved, but leave room for the wrath of God, for it is written: “VENGEANCE IS MINE, I WILL REPAY,” says the Lord.²⁰“BUT IF YOUR ENEMY IS HUNGRY, FEED HIM; IF HE IS THIRSTY, GIVE HIM A DRINK; FOR IN SO DOING YOU WILL HEAP BURNING COALS ON HIS HEAD.”²¹Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
Love first We all know all this. Some might say that it is christianity one o one. And that’s right. It is one of the fist things you learn as a christian. Basic christianity. And we don’t need basics. We are quite advanced in our walk with the Lord and therefore we need an advanced stuff. Right?
Let’s go back for about 15 years and 2000 kilometers. Back into my dark room. Where yanger version of me having my first vocal training session. And let’s learn something new together. I will teach you probobly one of the most powerful excersises for singers and speakers, anyone who uses their voice as an instrument.
Place your index fingers about an inch away from the corner of your mouth and gently push in and up. Relax your lips and do this BBBBB. Like a motorcycle engine. Be careful not to spit on the person in front of you though. You gotta relax your face. Otherwise it’s not gonna work. Comon, try it BBBBBB. Easy. But so powerful. 15 years later. I still do it. And not only me. Think of your favorite singer. It is almost garanteed that he does this excersise too. Every day of his life, until the end of his singing careere.
Excersising Do you see where we are going with this?
Our live is like a song we sing. Are you a good singer? When was the last time you practised excersises for your “spiritual voice”?
If don’t know any, the today is your day. Our scripture contains a few of them. Excersises that will teach you how to turn your life into a vocal melody of love for God.
We gonna look at 3 basic warm ups.
Exersice #1 #1 Practicing Love(Verse 9:).
First exersice is a simple warm-up — we start by exercising true love. It easy, it’s safe. It is a good starting point. Remember, in singin you end where you started. If you start with poor technichue, your voice not gonna sound nice. Your singing not going to be beautiful, so solid foundation is important!
But what should I do?
1 Corinthians 13:4-7 ⁴Love is patient, love is kind, it is not jealous; love does not brag, it is not arrogant.⁵It does not act disgracefully, it does not seek its own benefit; it is not provoked, does not keep an account of a wrong *suffered,*⁶it does not rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth;⁷it keeps every confidence, it believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
That’s a good place to start. Practice this twords your kids, your wife, your friends, parats. Annoying neighbours. etc.
But remember is is you who should be patient, kind, not jealous. Not them.
But it’s not all. Second part of verse 9 says Hate what is wrong. Hold tightly to what is good. That is also very important part of this worm up. Choice that we need to make daily. To guard our heart. Not to give the room to the enemy. Because, frankly if we let evel snick into our heart, then it is only a matter of time for our actions to catch up. It will rouin our spiritual voice.
Exersice #2 #2 Stretching. We need to stretch our vocal chords. To increase our vocal range.
Verses 10–13 call us to extend our love beyond the boundaries of our family. We should learn to treat our church as one.
Every church is a family… a slightly dysfunctional one, but family nonetheless.
At least that’s what they say…
Me and you, we are called to respect one another. In a genuane way of course. Even if we are not respected back.
We are called to work hard for the Lord. For the sake of his kingdom. Together. Even when things do not go well.
We are called to be devoted to prayer. As a family, as a church. And it is so for a reason.
They say that:
“Prayer is the powerhouse of the church”
Let’s ask ourselves. How much power we produce? Can we produce enough power to light up entire city(the one on the hill), or tiny LED unit is all we capable of, you know, bright enough to see the trail your on, but invisible from a couple miters away?
I think we can do better that this!
Verse 13. Contributing - emphasises our care for one another. Active and practical participation in one anothers lives and needs. It means that we should be open, we inviting people to come to us for help. Showing our genuane care for one another. Second half of the verse is about practising hospitality. The word “practicing” is actually qute strong in original language. N the verse 14 the same word translated as persecute! We should activly seek, we should persue people with hospitality. Showing our love in action, not just kind words.
When was the last time I practised hospitality? When was the last time I helped someone in church with their needs? Do I even know about their needs?
Please, be your own judge.
We also called to provide emotional support to one another.
Romans 12:15 ¹⁵Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.
Which implies that one should be willing to share about his highs and lows. And the other should be willing to listen, to empatize. Not advice! but listen. To be ready to cry together. Or laugh together. Even if you are on the low yourself. And that’s no easy job. That’s one skill to master.
Unfortunately we tend to start advice people instead. Or make it about ourselves. And that’s not it. Weep with those who weep. That’s all there is to it.
So, when did you last time cried with someone from your church? Did you ever?
Exsercise #2: Stretching our hearts and include our church.
Excersise #3 Exercise #3 — arguably the hardest one — is learning to let go.
Did you know that many amateur singers, myself included, often tense up? We often engage muscles that don’t actually help us sing — in fact, they resist. Muscles like our swallowing muscles, facial muscles, and the muscles in our throat.
And in order to release your voice, you shoul learn to relax them. You should learn to let go.
Verses 14, 17, 19 - all tell us about that.
As we learn to sing with our spiritual voice. We also tend to tense up. We have natural reactions that prevent our voices from singing freely. Our reaction to injustice.
Because we all crave justice — at least when it comes to our own sense of justice. When someone treats me unfairly, my whole being tenses up — and I want them to get a dose of their own medicine. And it is qute natural reaction. We used to it. But if we want to sing well, we should learn to let go.
In the moments like this we are called to move in the opposite spirit. We are called to bless, instead of cursing. To step back and not to take our own revange. We are called to be at peace with all people, if only possible.
It will truly realsea our voices. Unleashing our ability to sing the song of love to the Lord.
DO NOT BE OVERCOME BY EVIL And for me the verse 21 is a great summary of all of this.
Romans 12:21 ²¹Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
In real life, two negatives don’t make a positive. It’s only true for matematical problems. When it comes to real life. Poor technique will ruine your voice. Only with a proper technique you can sing a beautiful song.
Conclusion Maybe today was your first vocal training session ever. Today we leared 3 basic principles:
Warm up Streatch Let go These three must be practiced throughout our entire lives, enabling us to offer the song of love to our Lord.

Opposition We are continue our deep dive into a Life of worship. We continue to learn how we can glorify and honor God in every sphere of of our life.
Last week we said that our life is like a song. And our actions, our attutude is like the melody that we sing.
We glorify God when we chose to rely on His wisdom and guidance rather then our own. Otherwise we glorify ourselves and this worldly system.
Living by the wisdom of our own can take us places we don’t want to be in. That’s why our Father gave us an insite. He provides instructions, secret code. Cheetsheet if you will. That helps us to avoide struggles. Avoid mistakes.
Syco story I have previously mention that I grew up in a small town. It’s a nice place surrounded by forest. You cannot really tell now. But, back in the day, original idea was to build a town in such a way that if you look from above, all building would form a word. USSR. But then, soviet union fell and those plans came to an end. Leaving us only with USS but no R.
When I was growing up our town still preserved a bit of that nostalgic, post soviet, slightly depressing atmosphere. Especially in the Autumn. Grey sky, grey buildings, grey roads, grey everything. In the Autemn it get’s dark pretty early. And even during the day you are not gonna see too much sun. So, even a daylight is kinda grey.
On the one of such day. At the evening. When sun was long gone. And darkness swollen the streets me and my friend were walking around. Talking about life. We were teenagers. I guess that’s why night time was so attractive. Half of the street lights were broken, the other half was pretty dim and very yellow. Creating this post apocalyptic vibe. Most of the people were inside, enjoin their evening, getting ready for bad. Because, our town is not like Batumi. You have to get up very early to go to work. And that’s why there are almost no people on the streets after dark.
So, me and my boddy going down the empty street. Talking about some teenage stuff. We can see some guys from school a bit furthur away. We know some of them well, less so some other ounces. But anyway we should go and say hello to them.
We came closer. Shake hands. Start chatting. And as we having a small talk I look around. It’s dark, it’s quite. I’m slightly cold. Yellow light above the building entrance about 20 miters away trying it’s best to light up the night. Not achieving very much to be honest. Some guy walking home by himself. Puffed up jacket makes him look like MMA fighter.
I’m kinda wondering in my thought. Thinking that dim light makes him look huge. And somewhere at the back of my mind I hear one of the boys saying:
Hey, that’s Syco. Everything that fallowed have happened very quickly. Fractions of the second.
First I thought to myself “Syco”? I’ve heard about syco from boys. They were telling that they teething a guy. And he gets very mad very quckly. When he gets really mad, he chases them. And they run away. It is dump thing to do, that’s what I always though. But, I imagined that they talk about harmless, maybe slightly odd, elderly man. But this guy… Man… This guys look like a killing machine! You would not want to mess around with him.
As I’m thinking that someone from our crowd shouts:
Hey Syco, we’re here!!! My heart stopped. At that very moment, the guy — a beast of a man, a total unit — turned around and charged at us without a word.
All the other guys broke into a run — they were ready, they knew what was coming. They’d done this many times before. But me? I froze. Blacked out for a split second.
First thought to reach my mind, was the confident version of me saying: “Don’t run. You are not with them. You did nothing wrong therefore you are safe”.
Then reason kicked in with a counter-argument: “You think he cares? He’s not about talk — he’s about violence.”
That argument was strong enough. I ran. As fast as I could… The guy was fast, scary fast. But hey, I didn’t need to outrun him. Just the slowest guy in our crowd.
No choise And you know today. We can judge yang Viktar. Maybe we can say he could do better. He shuldn’t have been there in the first place. And probobly that is true.
But that night I didn’t get to chose. I was pulled into a struggle against my will. It did not metter that I don’t want to be part of this. That I was there by acident. That I’m sorry. The guy would choew me up and spit me out. Before I would even say a word.
I could not escape the situation. I had to decide what I’m going to do…
This world Why am I telling you this story? Because so often, life is the same way. We get pulled into struggles against our will. We wish things like that would never happen to us. I know how that feels — I’ve had my own battles, and I know some of yours. They’re real. We wish things were different.
But, that’s not an option. We can’t control that. But we can control how do we go about it! We always have two choises.
We can utilize the wisdom of this wold. And worship this worldly system. Or
We can use God’s wisdom. And glorify Him with the choices we make. Not easy Unfortunately, it’s not all that easy. Often times you not gonna be understood. You not gonna be supported and accepted by the people of this world. If you will rely on God’s wisdom.
His wisdom can look foolish and counter intuitive at least. Sometimes it even feels offensive to this world! People expect you to act just like them. And they ca get upset and angry if you don’t.
Sometimes God wisdoms feels hard even to us, those who is in the church right now. We can feel upset. We can feel liek we disagree with God’s wisdom!
If you don’t believe me. Let’s read our scripture for today than!
Romans 13:1-14 ¹Let every person be subject to the governing authorities. For there is no authority except from God, and those that exist have been instituted by God.²Therefore whoever resists the authorities resists what God has appointed, and those who resist will incur judgment.³For rulers are not a terror to good conduct, but to bad. Would you have no fear of the one who is in authority? Then do what is good, and you will receive his approval,⁴for he is God’s servant for your good. But if you do wrong, be afraid, for he does not bear the sword in vain. For he is the servant of God, an avenger who carries out God’s wrath on the wrongdoer.⁵Therefore one must be in subjection, not only to avoid God’s wrath but also for the sake of conscience.⁶For because of this you also pay taxes, for the authorities are ministers of God, attending to this very thing.⁷ Pay to all what is owed to them: taxes to whom taxes are owed, revenue to whom revenue is owed, respect to whom respect is owed, honor to whom honor is owed.
⁸ Owe no one anything, except to love each other…
What do you think now?
I think that that’s a tough scripture. I’m afraid I might actually get cancelled tonight. For many of us, one of the major reasons why we are here in Batumi, is because of our governing authorities.
And talking about this scripture, we will keep it close to the ground. Practical and relevant. We not gonna try to reflect on every single theoretically possible situation of every christian ever.
Better let’s aks ourselves what does it mean for me today? How does it impact my life here in Batumi, Georia?
Trobulation I got pulled into a struggle as a teenage. Agains my will. I had to decide what to do in my situation.
We didn’t get to choice when and were we were born. Often times we didn’t even get to choice what kind of authorities we are under. Maybe the are good, maybe they are bad. Sometimes they fulfill resposibility and function God assigned them to. Sometimes they care about themselves only.
And When this kind of situations rise up, it is no brainier what the world, what sosiety expects from me. - TO REBEL
Rebel Rebel became our standard reaction to express our protest. When we disagree. When we have enough of it. When we want something we don’t have, but as we think we deserve. We rebel.
As well look at the bible rebel is everywhere. People of Israel rebell again God all the time. In the garden of Eden, Adam and Even rebelled against God. But first to rebel was a Satan. He rebelled against God. Rebel - is his invention. It is his way of doing things.
Alternative We don’t want to go down the path of Satan don’t we? We need an alternative. Our scripture for today suggests a different pattern. Something quite opposite to rebel - SUBJECTION. It has a few bold statements that rub us the wrong way.
“there is no authority except from God…”
“whoever resists the authorities resists what God has appointed…”
“authorities are God’s servants…”
WHAT? Paul, are you out of your mind?
Authority is not inherantly bad. The institute of authorities itself is great tool. Designed by God. With a function and a perpose. It’s a tool that God uses.
So the problem is not the authority. The ultimate problem is sin. Corrupted hearts.
Paul Paul was not biased writing this lines. He himself experienced fare amount of persecution from the authorities during his lifetime. Roman government was not a fan of Christians by any stretch of the imagination. And yet, by the inspiration of the Holy Spirit Paul still writes this lines. “be in subjection”… “pay taxes”… Obey, Honor, Respect. Fulfill your duties and obligations as a citizent.
This is what God wants from you! Do this as an act of obedience to God. Act of worship.
Law breakers As I already mentioned God instituted authorities. They have function and responsibility before God. To serve people. To Protect them from wrongdoers. Punish the crime and etc. But even if they do not fulfill their function well. Even when THEY don’t do their part. God still want us to glorify Him, by fulfillin our part. By staying in subjection.
When governing authorities does not fulfill their function well. It does not give us a license to become law breakers. God wants us to follow the laws of the country we’re in. With an asterisk.
Asterisk Which is that we believe in superiority of Gods law. If state forces us to break the law of God, we are free to refuse to do that. In fact we should refuse to do that. We place the law of God above evey other law.
And His law is LOVE.
Exodus 1:15–21 Pharaoh commanded the Hebrew midwives to kill all newborn Hebrew boys. The midwives disobeyed the king’s order because they feared God more than man. Exodus 1:17 ¹⁷But the midwives feared God and did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them, but let the male children live.
As a result God blessed them for their obedience to His law rather than Pharaoh’s decree.
Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego Daniel Mordecai John the Baptist Peter and the Apostles It was not easy for any of them. They all had to live under ocupation by the nation. All faced this challenge how do I go about it? What do I do?.
And bible is clear: as much as possible we should obey both. State law and God’s commands. But in those rare cases when they contradict one another we should follow the law of God.
GOD BLESSES OBEDIENCE Rebel is not God’s way. Obedience is. God does not want us to suffer unnecessary persecution. God wants us to be free. Free to do His will. Free to work for His kingdom. Free to serve the lost. To take care of poor. Orphans, widows. Free to go and spread the Gospel.
God bless obedience. Obiedience as an act of worship!
Does not make wrong right Our obedience does not mean that all authorities are good. That we agree with all they do. No. It does’t justify their bad conduct. We should be in subjection not because governing authorities are great, but because we love God.
It is the act of worship.
Sometimes I forgive - as an act of worship. Because I love God. Sometimes I keep my mouth shut. And don’t reply to rudeness - as an act of worship. Because I love God. Same with subjection to authorities. I do that - as an act of worship. Because I love God.
So, today I want you to consider. How well you adhere to this scripture. Do you subject? Do you pay taxes? Do you render everything that is due?
It doesn’t mean that we should close our eyes, numb our hearts and ignore injustice. And blindly support everything authorities deside to do. No.
But when that happenes, our place is not on the streets fist fighting the police. Our battle is not against flesh and blood, but against the spiritual forces of evil. Our weapon is not a steel rod and broken beer bottle, but the prayer and love.
Even when the world around you suddenly turn full on Syco. And this beast charges at you. Like it was in my little story. God’s will for you is to avoid unnesesery persecusion.
To Love your enemy. To Bless your enemy.
To Render to everyone what is due to them.
God’s will for you is to Live your life as an act of worship to the Lord.
